etymologies: Old English flæx, of West Germanic origin; related to Dutch vlas and German Flachs, from an Indo-European root shared by Latin plectere and Greek plekein ‘to plait, twist’

definitions: a blue-flowered herbaceous plant that is cultivated for its seed (linseed) and for textile fiber made from its stalks.
shortDefinitions: blue-flowered plant cultivated for linseed and textile fibre

definitions: textile fiber obtained from the flax plant

examples.text: a mill for the preparation and spinning of flax

definitions: used in names of other plants of the flax family (e.g. purging flax) or plants that yield similar fiber (e.g. false flax).
shortDefinitions: used in names of other plants of flax family
